camel.source.path.configFile.name: camel.source.path.configFile
camel.source.path.configFile.description: Specifies the location to the solver file. If useSolverManager=FALSE, Camel uses this file and create the Solver. If useSolverManager=TRUE and SolverManager is set in the header {OptaPlannerConstants.SOLVER_MANAGER} : this file is ignored by Camel usage of SolverManager. SolverManager can be injected by DI in Quarkus or Spring.

camel.source.endpoint.problemId.name: camel.source.endpoint.problemId
camel.source.endpoint.problemId.description: In case of using SolverManager : the problem id

camel.source.endpoint.solverId.name: camel.source.endpoint.solverId
camel.source.endpoint.solverId.description: Specifies the solverId to user for the solver instance key

camel.source.endpoint.useSolverManager.name: camel.source.endpoint.useSolverManager
camel.source.endpoint.useSolverManager.description: use SolverManager instead of XML file config. Use this mode on Quarkus app.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.optaplanner.bridgeErrorH.name: camel.component.optaplanner.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.optaplanner.bridgeErrorH.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropert.name: camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.optaplanner.basicPropert.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
